intro: Gladiolus ecklonii subsp. rehmannii, commonly known as the Cape gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The subspecies rehmannii is distinguished by its deep purple to violet blooms with a contrasting white or cream throat. It typically grows in coastal areas and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its striking appearance and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
